page.title: 10LOCAL HISTORY (2)
page.content: St. Mary's{Church,}of Barnack stone, dates from 13thC. with stone seating round walls. Bell frame and bells were restored in 1972.Registers began in 1577.Henry VIII gave parish to Trinity College, still its patron.Richard Bentley, Trinity Master 1699-1742 built a house next the church which became the vicarage in 1840. Over was strongly Puritan during the Civil War and this remains so. The Baptist Church was rebuilt in 1812. Baptisms took place in local river and pond until 1930.The Primitive Methodist church was built in 1848. The only local{industry}was a brick factory(1850-1931) in Longstanton Rd. The 1966{census}showed people were employed in village fruit and flower growing, in 8 shops and in coal, building and plumbing.A stable 1600 population was expected by 1981.
